content.description: ​The rate of people entering a subway car on a particular day is modeled by the function <math alttext="R"><semantics><mi>R</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="R open parentheses t close parentheses equals 0.03 t cubed minus 0.846 t squared plus 6.587 t plus 1.428"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.03</mn> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>-</mo> <mn>0.846</mn> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>6.587</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1.428</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 20"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. <math alttext="R open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>R</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is measured in people per hour, and <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is measured in hours since the subway began service for the day.
content.question: Based on the model, at what value of <math alttext="t"> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> does the rate of people entering the subway car change from increasing to decreasing?

topic.text: 1.4: Polynomial Functions and Rates of Change

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
